com.okta.scim.server.example
Class Store

java.lang.Object
  com.okta.scim.server.example.Store

public class Store
extends java.lang.Object

An example Identity store. A singleton which supports the basic SCIM operations.

Note: Store.java is an example to show how to integrate with the SDK. This class is not performant, concise, or complete. It was written to show how to work with the data model of the SDK.

SCIMUser and SCIMGroup objects which are part of the data model of the SDK are used to interact with the SDK.

SCIMUser

SCIMUser has two properties:

  1. UserResource, an UnboundID representation of a SCIM User, is used to get all the Standard Properties (Core Schema) of the User. The standard properties of SCIMUser which would be converted to and from Okta are the userName, password, id (converted into the Okta App User's externalId), name (name.familyName and name.givenName), emails (primary and secondary), phone numbers (primary), and status.

    This is how you can set the standard properties:

    1. SCIMUser user = new SCIMUser(); //Create an empty user
    2. UserResource stdUser = user.getStandardUser(); //Get the empty standard user out of the SCIM user
    3. stdUser.setUserName("someValue"); //Start setting the values for the standard properties
    4. stdUser.setId("someOtherValue");
    5. Collection<Entry<String>> emails = new ArrayList>(); //emails and phone numbers are arrays.

      You need to create a collection like this

          Entry email1 = new Entry("abc@eample.com", "work", true);
    ...
    emails.add(email1);
    6. stdUser.setEmails(emails); //Set the array emails to the user
    7. Name name = new Name("Mr. John Smith", "Smith", null, "John", null, null); //Name is a complex property.
      Create like this: stdUser.setName(name); //Set the name to the standard user
    8. user.setStandardUser(stdUser); //Set the standard user to the SCIMUser

    Similarly, get these standard properties as follows:

    1. String userName = user.getStandardUser().getUserName(); //Get a non-nested simple property like userName, Id, ExternalId, Status
    2. String firstName = user.getStandardUser().getName().getGivenName(); //Get a nested simple property like firstName, lastName
    3. Entry firstEntry = user.getStandardUser().getEmails().get(0); //Get an array element
    4. String firstEmail = firstEntry.getValue(); //Get the value of that array element

  2. If you need to set properties in addition to the standard properties, you can set them as custom properties in a namespace different from that of the standard properties. Note that currently only one custom namespace is supported. The custom namespace is based on the appName you created on Okta. For example, if your appName is onprem_app, the custom namespace would be urn:okta:onprem_app:1.0:user. In general, the custom namespace would of the form urn:okta:{appName}:1.0:user. You need to know your appName if you want to use the custom namespaces. You can login to Okta and go to your App to find this information.

    The datatypes supported are String, Boolean, Integer, and Double.

    There are two ways to get and set CustomProperties. In the examples below, assume that the custom namespace is urn:okta:onprem_app:1.0:user.

    1. Access the customPropertiesMap of SCIMUser which is a CustomSchemaName -> JsonNode map for all the custom properties.

      Example to Set a custom property

       JsonNode node = new JsonNode(); //Create a Jackson Json Node
 node.put("customField1", "abc"); //Set string value
 node.put("customField2", 123);   //Set an int value
 Map customMap = new HashMap(); //Create a new map to be set to the SCIMUser
 customMap.put("urn:okta:onprem_app:1.0:user", node); //Put an entry in the map with the URN
 user.setCustomPropertiesMap(customMap); //Set the custom properties map to the SCIM user

      Example to Get a custom property

       String customField1 = user.getCustomPropertiesMap().get("urn:okta:onprem_app:1.0:user").get("customField1").asText();
 You need to traverse the Json Node if the custom field is nested.

    2. Use getters and setters – SCIMUser.getCustomStringProperty, getCustomIntProperty, setCustomStringProperty, setCustomIntProperty, etc.

      Example to Set a custom property

       user.setCustomStringValue("urn:okta:onprem_app:1.0:user", "customField1", "abc"); //Set a root level custom property
 user.setCustomStringValue("urn:okta:onprem_app:1.0:user", "customField1", "abc", "root", "subRoot"); //Set a nested custom property
 //where the "subRoot" is the parent of "customField1" and "root" is the parent of "subRoot".
      Similar methods including setCustomIntValue, setCustomDoubleValue, setCustomBooleanValue exist for the other data types.

      Example to Get a custom property

       user.getCustomStringValue("urn:okta:onprem_app:1.0:user", "customField1"); //Get a root level custom property
 user.getCustomStringValue("urn:okta:onprem_app:1.0:user", "customField1", "root", "subRoot"); //Get a nested custom property

SCIMGroup

SCIMGroup also has two properties:

  1. GroupResource, an UnboundID representation of the standard properties of SCIMGroup, is used to set and get all the standard properties of SCIMGroup. The standard properties of SCIMGroup which are converted to and from Okta AppGroup are displayName, id (Converted to/from the externalId of the Okta AppGroup), and the group memberships.

    This is how you can set the standard properties of SCIMGroup:

    1. SCIMGroup group = new SCIMGroup(); //Create an empty group
    2. GroupResource stdGroup = user.getStandardGroup(); //Get the empty standard group out of the SCIM group
    3. stdGroup.setDisplayName("someValue"); //Set the display name
    4. stdGroup.setId("someOtherValue"); //Set the Id
    5. Collection> groupMemberships = new ArrayList>(); //Create the collection for group members, detailed below. 
          Entry member = new Entry("101", null); //Create a member entry for a user whose ID is 101.
    member.setDisplay("someValue"); //Set the userName for that user member as the display.
    groupMemberships.add(member); //Add the member
    6. stdGroup.setMembers(groupMemberships); //Set the members to the standard group
    7. group.setStandardGroup(stdGroup); //Finally, set the standard group to the SCIMGroup

    Similary, get these properties from a SCIMGroup, as follows: 

        String displayName = group.getStandardGroup().getDisplayName();
    Entry firstMember = group.getStandardGroup().getMembers().get(0);
  2. Custom Properties

    Currently, only one custom property (description) is supported for an AppGroup. Note that the custom namespace for the Group is a constant and is not dependent on the appName. Get/Set the description of the AppGroup - 

     group.setCustomStringValue(SCIMOktaConstants.APPGROUP_OKTA_CUSTOM_SCHEMA_URN, SCIMOktaConstants.OKTA_APPGROUP_DESCRIPTION, "Group Description"); //Set the value
 String description = group.getCustomStringValue(SCIMOktaConstants.APPGROUP_OKTA_CUSTOM_SCHEMA_URN, SCIMOktaConstants.OKTA_APPGROUP_DESCRIPTION); //Get the value

To understand more about the UnboundID SDK and how to work with the SCIMUser.standardUser, the UnboundID UserResource and SCIMGroup.standardGroup, the UnboundID GroupResource, you can go to https://code.google.com/p/scimsdk/ and download the SDK which contains the Javadoc.

Throw the following three exceptions, as shown in the implementations below, as noted.

  • EntityNotFoundException - If an update/delete/get request is received for /Users and /Groups but the resource with the ID is not found.
  • DuplicateGroupException - If we get a create request for /Groups but a duplicate group exists
Note: For both the above exceptions, the SDK associates an error code and a message with the exception automatically.
  • OnPremUserManagementException - If there is any other exceptional condition (You cannot access the remote application, remote application threw an exception, etc).

For OnPremUserManagementException you can create the exception with any of the following four different properties.

  • Internal Code - Any arbitrary code to associate with the exception.
  • Description - Description for the exception.
  • Helper URL - If there is any URL for referral to help fix the issue.
  • Exception - Any associated exception.

Note: For all exceptions described above, if the code throws the exception while processing a UM operation, the exception is serialized into a json string that is visible in Okta UI, as shown below.

"Failed on 11-24-2013 11:15:25PM UTC: Unable to delete Group Push mapping target App group ogroup-1: Error while deleting user group ogroup-1: The Provisioning Agent call to deleteGroup failed. Error code: 404, error: Not Found. Errors reported by the connector : {"errors":[{"statusCode":404,"internalCode":"E0000048","description":"Cannot delete the group - Cannot find the group with the id [1004]","help_url":null}]}"

getUsers

public SCIMUserQueryResponse getUsers(PaginationProperties pageProperties)
Example for getting the users. See getUsers(PaginationProperties, Filter) to see how you can implement the getUsers method.

getGroups

public SCIMGroupQueryResponse getGroups(PaginationProperties pageProperties)
Example for getting the groups.

This example is similar to the getUsers(). The only difference is there is no filter for getting groups You should return all the groups. If the total number of groups is more than the number of groups the client requests, as specified in the pagination properties, then return only the number of groups requested by the client and set the number of totalResults to the response.

createGroup

public SCIMGroup createGroup(SCIMGroup group)
Example for creating a group.

You should throw a DuplicateGroupException if the group already exists. If you do not throw the exception when a duplicate group is found, Okta cannot figure out if the group already exists or not.

updateGroup

public SCIMGroup updateGroup(java.lang.String id,
                             SCIMGroup group)
Example for updating a group.

Throw an EntityNotFoundException if the group is not found.

getUserByFilter

public java.util.List<SCIMUser> getUserByFilter(SCIMFilter filter)
A simple example of how to use SCIM Filters to return a list of users which match the filter criteria.

An Admin who configures the UM would specify a SCIM field name as the UniqueId field name. This field and its value would be sent by Okta in the filter. While implementing the connector, the below points should be noted about the filters.

If you choose a single valued attribute as the UserId field name while configuring the App Instance on Okta, you would get an equality filter here. For example, if you choose userName, the Filter object below may represent an equality filter like "userName eq "someUserName"" If you choose the name.familyName as the UserId field name, the filter object may represent an equality filter like "name.familyName eq "someLastName"" If you choose a multivalued attribute (email, for example), the Filter object below may represent an OR filter consisting of two sub-filters like "email eq "abc@def.com" OR email eq "def@abc.com"" Of the few multi valued attributes part of the SCIM Core Schema (Like email, address, phone number), only email would be supported as a UserIdField name on Okta. So, you would have to deal with OR filters only if you choose email.

When you get a SCIMFilter, you should check the filter field name (And make sure it is the same field which was configured with Okta), value, condition, etc. as shown in the examples below.

Parameters:
filter - UnboundId representation of a SCIM filter.

getUsers

public SCIMUserQueryResponse getUsers(PaginationProperties pageProperties,
                                      SCIMFilter filter)
Get users based on pagination properties and a filter. Both of these properties are optional. The SDK would check the validity of these properties before making the call to the implementation.

You are supposed to set the totalResults and the List of the SCIMUser to the SCIMUserQueryResponse. If pagination is not null, you should set the startIndex to the response.

If you get a filter, you are supposed to return the list of SCIMUser which match the criteria of the filter.

deleteGroup

public void deleteGroup(java.lang.String id)
Delete a group based on the id provided. Throw an EntityNotFoundException if the group does not exist
